Hello,

I'm using Cantera in combination with Matlab/Simulink doing dynam=
ic 
calculations of a steam reforming process of methane. The Cantera 
calc=
ulation is part of a differential equation used to determine the 
reactor t=
emperature via the energy balance. The Cantera part itself 
only involves t=
he calculation of chemical equilibrium 
using "equilibrate(gas, 'TP')" and =
the calculation of the heat of 
reaction.  At some points I've come across =
the problem of negative 
mole fractions for methane:

   MATLAB error messa=
ge:
   Error using =3D=3D> thermophase/equilibrate
   Procedure: update
   =
Error:   negative mole fraction for CH4: -1.#IND

Since the mole fractions =
entering Cantera are not negative I assume 
that this is due to a convergen=
ce problem of Cantera. Is there a 
possibilty of avoiding this problem?

Bj=
=F6rn
